title: How to Clean Stains from a Linen Chair

steps.headline: Make a paste from baking soda (bicarbonate of soda) mixed with water.
steps.description: The paste should be fairly loose in consistency.

steps.headline: Apply the paste generously to the stained areas of the chair.
Leave the paste to dry.
steps.description: It will self-adhere and dry anywhere from half an hour to a few hours, depending on how much paste you have had to use.

steps.headline: Brush off the paste using a soft, clean cloth.
steps.description: Check to see if the stain has been removed. Repeat if needed, otherwise you should have a clean linen chair once again.

tyn: Baking soda / bicarbonate of soda (enough to form a paste)
Soft cleaning cloth (neutral colour/not dyed, to be sure that it won't run on the linen)
